inn1.comm: some swing there. Starts early in the trajectory, bobs away from Omar who lets it go through to Boucher
closer to the off stump and it moves away again. Omar lunges forward, covers the off stump and shoulders arms.
beaten. Fuller and in the temptation zone, Omar tried to free his arms but the bat swung inside the line.
lands outside off stump, goes on, Omar, who has a open-stance, thrust his left foot across, withdrew his bat and watched the ball sail into Boucher's gloves
lands on the off stump, straightens a touch, Omar lunges forward, gets his bat in front of his pad and defends
shorter in length, on the off and middle stump line, Omar defends on the front foot. Didn't bounce as much as he expected.
way outside the off stump. That Ntini angle takes it even further. Wide called.
Sweet. Fullish and outside off, Tamim is quick to get on to that front foot and drives through extra cover. Driven on a bent knee. Eye-catching.
lands outside leg stump, full in length, Tamim, who also has a open-stance, tries to flick it, misses and it thuds in to the pad.
beaten. Beauty. Landed outside leg stump, shaped away and Tamim is squared-up and ends up poking at it.
lands on a length, outside leg stump, moves towards middle, Tamim taps it to on side, wants a single but Omar sends him back.
beaten again. Perfect length, on the middle stump line and moves away, Tamim is sucked into the forward prod.

Dropped by Kemp at second slip. It was full and wide and Tamim couldn't resist the urge. He threw his arm at it, got an thick outside edge and the ball flew fast to right of Kemp, above head-high, who palmed it away.
In the zone outside off, Javed Omar pushes at it, gets a outside edge to third man
full in length, around off stump, pushed to extra cover and they set off for a single
slipping down the leg side. Second wide of the game. Pollock was trying to get this one in but ....
fuller, straighter, on the middle and off,  Omar leans forward to defend.
length-delivery on the off and middle, comes in a touch, pushed to cover. Pollock is locking up the batsman here. Watch out for the one that moves away
full and straight, on the off and middle again, driven to mid-on. The bottom-hand powered that drive and he doesn't get the full clean swing as a result
length-delivery outside off, slashed away on the up, straight to cover
almost chopped on. Full in length, lands outside leg stump, moves across Tamim who tries to play it with soft hands. Too soft and the ball almost rolls back on to the off stump.
squared-up. Landed outside leg, moved in, Tamim pushes at it, edges it to the off side.
whooshes through the off stump line, left alone
swing and a miss. Again Tamim got itchy seeing the width- it was full and well outside off, but he doesn't move his feet towards the line. Misses.
beaten. Rushes through the zone, just outside off, Tamim plays at it, inside the line and the ball teases the outside edge.
Another wild swing. Another miss. It was full and outside off, Tamim tried to drill it through cover.
This time its turn of Omar to get beaten. Outside off , from a length, and Omar tried to drive on the up.
dabbed down to third man for a single
length-delivery, angling away from Tamim who pats it close on the off side.
Full in the zone, outside off stump, Tamim has a flash and miss. He is teasing the slip fielders.
slower one, full in length, defended on the front foot
beaten again. Deja-vu. In the zone outside off and it cuts away, Tamim's bat comes inside the line. Luckily, he didn't chase that.
fullish, on the legs, glanced away to fine leg
landed outside leg stump, moves towards middle and off, Tamim nudges it to the on side
There he goes. Charges out, backing outside leg stump in the process, Ntini follows him and he pushes it to cover.
he is beaten again. I have lost count of the no of times he has been beaten. But importantly, for Bangladesh, he is still there. Again outside off and sharp movement away and another play and a miss.
Smooth. Leans forward, towards the line and caresses it straight down the track.
landed outside leg stump, on a length, moves in towards the hips, clipped past square-leg.

Ah! A fullish delivery outside off and you guessed it right. Another swing and a miss. Omar tries to drill it through the off side, the bat comes down in angle and the ball rushes past the outside edge
Omar breaks free with a cut. Short and outside off, Omar waited and cut it past point. He didn't move back and across, just shifted his weight on to the back foot, and cut at the width
Here comes a bouncer. Swayed away.
full-pitched outside off, driven to mid-off
on a length, around the off stump, dabbed to the on side.
full in length, on the middle and leg, Omar doesn't wrist it away. Instead, just turns it to the on side.
on the off and middle stump line, pushed back down the track.
on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg
banged in short, at the body, Tamim hops up, lets the ball move across him, opens the bat-face, runs it down to third man
short in length, comes in from outside off stump, Omar goes back, dabs it to the third man region
pitched on a length, outside leg stump, cuts across Tamim who goes back, plays it to cover
full in length, angling away, Tamim eases towards the line, drives on the up but straight to cover

A mad dash down the track and a heave over cover. Typical Tamim. He did that quite profitably against the Indians. He tried earlier against Ntini but the bowler changed the line that time. Here it was going away from him and he drove on the up, over cover.
defended on the front foot
whipped past square-leg.  Fullish, on the legs and he wrists it away. That bottom-hand meant the ball went in the air and over square-leg.
shuffles across, gets behind the line of a length-delivery around middle and off, pushes it to cover point
on a length, around off, Omar gets behind the line, opens the bat-face and runs it to third man
full and on the off stump line, Tamim leans across, drives to cover.
Full, straight, nagging line and length, on the middle stump line, driven back to Pollock.
length-delivery, angling in towards the middle, pushed to the on side

loud shout for lbw. From wide of the crease, Ntini hurled in a full and at the stumps. Omar is rapped on the pad, in front of middle stump. It looked pretty close. It would have leg stump but Billy Doctrove is not convinced.
landed outside leg stump, comes in a touch but it's still outside leg and flicked away to fine leg.
again from wide of the crease, short in length, on the middle stump line, Omar hops across, tries to dab it to the on side, ends up defending
back of length, rises up, outside off stump, Omar shapes to push at it, in an effort to run it down to third man, but withdraws his bat at the last minute.
length-delivery on the off and middle, Tamim drives on the up but the bottom-hand comes out of the handle and the ball rolls back to the bowler.
fullish, on the middle and off stump line, pushed back to the bowler. Again Boucher, standing up to the stumps, is pretty impressed with Polly.
landed on a length, outside off and it bounced a touch. Tamim tried to square-drive it on the up, misses and the ball bounds off Boucher's gloves and drops in front.
leans forward, drives a length-delivery, on the up, towards extra cover
Slower one, off cutter, on the off stump line, played to short third man.
Hits the target rightaway. Fullish and slanting away from Tamim who goes for an expansive drive, misses.
Comes down the track, backs away in the process, slashes a length-delivery to widish third man
fuller, outside off, Omar leans forward, opens the bat-face, guides it through backward point
full again, on the middle and leg this time, driven to mid-on.
They will have to wait. Omar continues to stick adhesively to the crease. Stands up tall to defend a short of length delivery on the middle stump line.
Outside off, full in length and Omar icily leaves it well alone.
length-delivery, around off stump, slashed on the up, to mid-off.

Dropped by Boucher. It landed on a length, slanted away from Tamim who tries to square-drive on the up, nicks it to Boucher. In and out of his gloves. He is standing up to the stumps and that's the risk you take while doing so. Some times it sticks, sometimes it slips.
defended to the off side
slow off cutter, on the middle stump line, tucked to fine leg.
another slow off cutter, nudged to the on side
off cutter, outside off stump, dabbed to backward point
full in length, on the off and middle stump line, defended to cover
length-delivery, coming in from outside off, nudged to point
short of length, angling in, on the hips, tucked away to fine leg

Gone! Slashes away to his peril. Short of length and outside off, Omar's eyes lit up at the width, has a slash but it flashes fast but straight to Smith at Gully.Omar falls after a patient knock. He has laid the platform. Can the rest do something with it? Time will tell.
beaten by the pace. Short of lenght, cuts in and thuds into the inner thigh and bounds away to first slip. Boucher didn't get his bat down. Hmm..

snorter. Kicks up from short of length, rears up at the throat like cobra, Bashar is surprised but does well to take the bottom-hand out of the handle, arches back to fend it away. Welcome to the crease Mr Bashar.
length-delivery from Langeveldt, around off stump, pushed to cover point

Wow. Short and outside off stump, Tamim flat-bats it, ala Gilchrist, over extra cover. A lady in the crowd certainly loved it. She cradles a baby doll. Like how Bebeto and Romario used to do in the football World Cup.
full and straight, again Tamim tries to thrash it, the bat-face shut a bit and the ball rolls to the left of mid-off
on the off and middle, defended on the front foot.
full and just outside off, Bashar leans forward, dabs it to cover
beaten. Fullish but this one straightens and Bashar's bat goes inside the line. He wanted to drill that one through the off side ring but was beaten by the straigtening of the delivery.
Full in length, on the middle and off , eased to cover
lands  on the middle, on a length, angles in, Tamim leans forward, pushes it, right-elbow high, back to the bowler.
on the leg stump line, bounces a touch, Tamim taps it to the on side, towards mid-on and they rush across for a quick single.
length-delivery on the middle and leg, Bashar opens up his stance, tucks it behind square-leg.
banged it in, rises up at the chest, on the leg stump line, tucked to fine leg. 50 up for Bangladesh. Slow and steady.
fuller, on the middle and leg stump line, Bashar arrests his front foot movement, leans forward, flicks it to fine leg
slightly short in length, outside off and driven to point
slower one, but it is short and well outside off, Bashar reaches it and cuts past backward point. Nel rushes across to his right from wide third man to make the stop.
beaten. Kicks up from a length outside off, Bashar stays adjacent to the line, feels for it and is beaten.

bumper, Bashar shapes to pull and it bounces over the blade. This is getting interesting. Bashar is losing his patience, he has been out of form. Let's see how he goes about his task. Will he try to hit his way out?
fullish, outside off, driven to left of mid-off
Crash. Bang. Wallop. He charges down the track and flat-bats a short of length delivery over the bowler. Tennis shot. Double-handed fore hand down the line.

Super reflex catch. Full in length, on the middle stump line, Bashar drives uppishly to right of Nel who is in the middle of his follow-through. No problem though. He stretches his right hand out and the ball nestles into his palm.
from round the stump, full and straight on the middle stump line, pushed down the track
A bouncer. Ducked under.
lands on a length, around off stump, comes in a touch, played to backward point.
yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, on the legs, clipped away
slips down the leg side, above waist-high.
banged in short of length, swayed away and it sails down the leg side
leans forward, drives to mid-off
full in length, on the legs, tries to flick it away, misses and it runs off the pad
back of length, around off stump - another no ball, pushed to point
slower one, on the middle stump line, Tamim pushes it out to the off side. He prefers the off side, very rarely does he play to the other side.
short in length, on the off stump line, bounces waist-high, punched to wide third man
beaten. Short in length, outside off, tries to square-drive but it climbs more than he expected.
full, straight, on the off and middle, he stays adjacent to the line, drives to mid-off
from round the stumps, on the middle and leg, defended back down the track
fuller, on the middle stump line, Tamim is caught at the crease, his feet stuck and he adjusts to the length, by lunging forward, inside-edges a drive to the on side
lapped over Boucher. Tamim is surprised by the bouncer, tries to pull and ends up lapping it up over Boucher who had moved to his right, down the leg side.

For the first time Tamim tried heaving over the leg side while advancing down the track. He didn't quite pull it off. Ended up nicking it to Boucher. He ran down the track to a back-of-length delivery and tried to pull but ....
attempted yorker, ends up low full toss, on the legs, flicked away behind square-leg
on the off stump line, guided to point
length-delivery, outside off stump, punched to cover point
back of length, on the off and middle stump line, pushed back down the track
full in length, on the middle stump line, driven to mid-off
slower one, full and on the middle and off stump line, pushed to mid-off
short of length, outside off, pushed to point
length-delivery, on the off stump line, punched to cover
from round the stumps, speared on the leg stump line, tries to work it to leg side, gets a inside-edge on to the pads
close run. Pushed to extra cover, Ashraful wants a run, comes down the track but is sent back
Slightly short in length, Saqib pulls, gets under it and it balloons over wide mid-on
bouncer, Saqib shapes to pull, ends up gloving it to the on side
lands outside off stump, comes in a touch, left alone
runs down the track, drives to mid-on
slower one, outside off, pushed to cover
slap. Short and outside off, Saqib goes back and across, gets on top of the bounce and cuts it to left of backward point
full and around off, driven to widish mid-off. It was a slower one. Well picked up by Ssqib
length-delivery, outside off, pushed to cover point
change of pace. Slower one, on the off and middle, pushed back down the track.
fullish, around off stump line, defended down the track
overpitched on the middle stump line, driven to mid-off. Almost at the blockhole.
full in length, driven down the ground.

Another one caught behind point. It was banged in short, rises up shoulder-level, just outside off, Saqib went back, hopped up, tried to get on top of the bounce but couldn't. And he ended up patting it straight to Smith at backward point.
Kallis tries another short-pitched stuff but this one sails down the leg side
fuller, outside off stump, Aftab, who has had the quiet WC so far, leans forward to defend
Another bouncer, ducked under and it's called a wide. The height was the problem.
gets off the mark with a dab to widish mid-on.
turns down the leg side.
And again.
short in length, turns in from off stump line, bunted past midwicket
leans forward to defend to off side
full outside off, driven through cover for an easy single
back of a length this time, defended off the back foot down the ground
short outside off, Ashraful thinks of the slash but holds himself back. This isn't the time for rashness, he seems to be thinking. Kallis varying his length well here
back of a length, rising on the batsman, Ashraful pats it to the off side and attempts a single but the batsmen decide against it. Pressure, pressure.
short and slightly outside leg side, Ashraful thinks of the pull but holds back. Wide called
good length outside off, tapped to the off side, inside edge onto pads. Ball drops close to the batsmen but they decide against a risky single

deflected to third man and the batsmen scamper a quick two. Pollock picks up the ball and flings it in quickly but the throw is slightly wide and Boucher takes that little extra time to take the bails off. Third umpire is consulted and the verdict is an expected not out
turned to short fine leg
driven down the ground to long-off, collision between Petersen at cover and Smith. Both miss the ball and the batsmen complete a single
driven down the ground to long-on
turned behind square for a single
driven to long-on, 100 up for Bangladesh. Aftab and Ashraful doing it sensible here. Bangladesh will hope they continue in the same vein
full length ball outside off, patted to the off side
full outside off again, cutely glided to third man for a single. He waited for the offcutter and turned the bat at the last moment. Sweet shot
defended to the off side cautiously
back of a length on middle, Ashraful gets carefully behind the line and defends it to mid-on
back of a length on off, defended patiently
slightly slower from Kallis, good length on off. Ashraful pats it back to the bowler
turned away behind square for a sensible single
Oh! Slightly shot and wide, Ashraful goes for the cut and there appears to be a touch. Boucher lets out a huge appeal but umpire Benson doesn't give in. Replays show there might have been a nick
driven to long-on for a single
played away to the on-side
lofted over mid-on for a fine four. Aftab waited for that, saw the gap and went for the loft. Good thinking
left alone to the keeper
off cutter on off stump, pushed to the off side
not the most convincing hook, short on middle and leg, Ashraful gets a thick glove to it and the ball beats Boucher to the fine leg fence
that was worth driving miles to see! short, Ashraful picks the length early and pulls off the meat of the bat, ball races to the square leg fence
left alone to the keeper watchfully
Kallis bowls this one fuller, Ashraful drives hard but straight to mid-off
Boucher stands upto the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
off cutter outside off, Aftab gets forward and dabs it to point, mid off and mid on are in the circle
a bit of width offered, Aftab gets on the backfoot and cuts hard to point
pushed back to the bowler, Pollock managing to keep Aftab quiet here
even slower offcutter drifting on the pads, Aftab turns it to fine leg
offcutter this time a touch wide outside off, Aftab reads it well, opens the face of the bat and steers it to third man
Kallis too slips in his offcutters, pushed back to the bowler off the front foot
just a tad short of a length, no room to cut or pull, played back to the bowler
steered towards third man past the diving gully, the batsmen scamper through for a double and Ashraful just makes his ground, no need for a referral
offcutter again, Ashraful is drawn forward, defended back to the bowler
on the pads,picked away off the front foot with ease over the infield, ball races over midwicket
driven towards the on side
length-delivery on the leg and middle, dabbed to midwicket
fullish, outside off, square-driven to point
short of length, outside off, he waited for it and ran it down to third man
fullish, on the middle stump line, driven down the ground
slower one, outside off and is beaten
length-delivery, outside off, again dabbed to third man region
around the off stump line, he leans forward, guides to gully region
short in length, outside off stump, Ashraful goes back and across, late cuts it to third man
short in length, slipping down the leg side, Aftab shapes to pull, misses, and it runs off the pad to fine leg boundary
Full in length, outside off, nicely guided to third man.
Cute. Slower one - off cutter ,outside off, Ashraful moved back and across, opened the bat-face and late cut it.
Another cut to third man. Easy.
slower one, fullish, outside off stump, Aftab tries to drill it square, gets a outside-edge, down to third man.
short in length, around off stump, tapped to cover
Again third man comes into play. Another late cut.
full in length, on the middle and off, Aftab tries to steer it third man, can't get it past backward point.
short and wide, cut to deep point.
short in length, lands outside off, goes on straight, Aftab tries to square-cut but doesn't make contact
Super strike. Fullish, drifting on to the legs, Aftab leant forward, swung it over long leg. Wonderfully picked up. Clean swing of the bat.
length-delivery around off stump line, pushed to cover point
That's a biggie. A slower-one, full and on the middle and leg stump line, Aftab clears his front leg from the line and swings it over deep midwicket. Up... up and over. Big hit.
length-delivery, outside off stump, defended back down the track
fullish, on the middle stump line, tucked behind square-leg. Aftab wanted a second, takes a few steps, is sent back and he dives to get back into his crease
Classy. Full and on the leg and middle, nonchalantly glanced away. Eye-catching stroke. Easy on the eye.
leans forward, turns a length-delivery to midwicket
again slipping down leg, Aftab tries to glance it away , doesn't get much wood behind that.
on the hips, clipped away to fine leg
full in length, outside off, tapped to the cover region
length-delivery outside off stump, tries to run it down to third man, gets a under-edge, on to the ground and it runs to Boucher
tastes success this time. A single down to third man.
leans forward to a full-length delivery outside off, opens the bat-face and steers it to third man. Lots of singles have come in that area as the two continue to cut and dab.

It was a fluent drive. I thought it was going to go to four. Instead, it goes to the man at sweeper cover. Fullish, outside off and he drove it uppishly over cover. Nel moves to his right , swoops low to take the catch.
on the off stump line, Ashraful shuffles across, wants to tickle it to leg side, doesn't connect well
No shuffling this time, he pulls out his favourite dab to third man
on the middle and leg, tucked behind square-leg.
banged in short, on the middle and leg, Ashraful rocked back and pulled it fine. Very fine.
length-delivery on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg for a single
hits the deck short of length, on the middle stump line, pushed to the off side.
length-delivery, outside off and you know where it went. Yep, to third man
short of length, around off stump, nudged to cover point, both want a single initially, both realise there isn't one and retreat
short and wide. Very wide.
fuller and outside off, left alone
There was a gully and a backward point. Still he finds the gap between them. Another run to third man.
ooh. Swing and a miss. Full and outside off, enough for Ashraful to decide it has to go to Dhaka, has one mighty swing but doesn't connect
leans back, pats a length-delivery to third man. I am running out of words to describe his shots to third man
bouncer and Rahim drops his wrists, and sways away
short in length delivery, on the off stump line, lapped around the corner
Ah! You know where this one went.
slightly short and cut past point
from wide of the crease, short in length, angling in, Rahim tries to cut, bat comes in a angle, neither vertical nor horizontal and he almost chops it on to the stumps
short in length and Rahim pulls. Pulls wells to left of Prince at deep midwicket
fuller, just outside off stump, square-driven to cover point
overpitched outside off stump, driven to cover where Peterson, the sub, dives to make a stop.
retains the strike with a drive past the bowler

Rahim sacrifices his wicket. That was the right thing to do but he created the mess in the first place. Ashraful had driven a full-pitched delivery to left of mid-on where Kemp dived to make a fine stop. Ashraful had called early and had run right across. Rahim had started but for some reason stalled, was caught ball-watching and tried to get back to his crease. Then he saw Ashraful rushing across. For a moment both were at similar position. Who will get first to the safety of the crease? Suddenly, Rahim decides he has get to the other end and save Ashraful's wicket. He doesn't manage to reach the other end though.
leans forward, defends a full-pitched delivery to the off side
slower one, full in length, driven to long on
Cute. Too cute. Ashraful shuffles right across the stumps. Nel fires in a low full toss down the leg side. Ashraful tries to paddle it away, misses.
beamer down the leg  side, defended to the leg side. Nel shouts out, "Sorry Mate" to the batsman.
full and around off, pushed to the off side.
quick single. A dab to the on side. Ashraful back on strike.
Ashraful just smoked it. Full-pitched, on the middle and off and he creamed it right over the bowler's head.
Cheeky. Very cheeky. A shuffle to outside the off stump and he scoop-paddled  a full-length delivery from there to fine leg. Ashraful is upping the ante.
Full-pitched outside off, he goes for a slog drive, ends up scooping it over cover
Bosh. Length-delivery off,  cut fiercely past point. This is the Ashraful that we know.
full and slipping on to the legs, tries to flick it away, misses and the ball thuds into pad
full in length, on middle and leg, swung behind square-leg
forehand down the line. Tamim did it before, Mortaza smashes one now. Short in length and outside off, Mortaza takes the left leg out of the way and blasts it down the ground.
full toss, pushed down the ground
yorker-length delivery, on the middle and leg, Ashraful moves across, tries another paddle-sweep, doesn't quite manage it and the ball rolls to left of short fine leg
Runs keep coming. Fullish, on the legs, flicked past that man in short fine leg region. Better to flick than paddle.
almost at the blockhole, on the off stump line, driven to mid-off
slashed away. Full-pitched, well outside off stump, Ashraful reaches out and slices it through backward point
low full-toss, on the off stump line, swung to long on
full in length, on the off stump line, Ashraful drills it to mid-off and picks up a single.
The white ball is flying everywhere. Overpitched on the stumps, down comes the bat, under the ball and she soars over the bowler and over the ropes. Good clean hit.
ANOTHER. This one disappears into the deep midwicket boundary. Another lusty swing, this time across the line. Mortaza is doing more than his bit here.
overpitched on the off stump line, driven down the track
Fab shot. Fullish, outside off and Ashraful went down on his knee and just punched it through point. Nonchalantly played.
yorker-length, on the middle, bunted through square-leg
yorker, outside off, down comes Mortaza's bat in a hurry, jabs it to point

Oh ho! Ashraful you little beauty. Again he goes right across the stumps, takes a full-toss on the off and middle and guides to between the keeper and the short fine leg fielder. Paddling away merrily.

Backs away this time. Another low full toss arrives on the middle stump line. He doesn't swing or slog. Just stands up, punches it through extra cover to widish long off region. Another well-executed stroke.
full-toss, on the stumps, smashed straight to cover

Nel comes up with a super yorker. Full, straight, homing in on the middle stump. Mortaza tries to bring his bat down but the ball evades the blade and the furniture is disturbed. A nice little cameo comes to an end.
another yorker, on the middle and leg, dug out, back to the bowler.

There he goes again. Another paddle shot. Shuffles across the line, swoops low and helps a fullish delivery on the middle stump line, over the man at short fine leg. Scoop paddle. It's a risky shot but he is making it look a percentage stroke. That is no mean achievement.
retains the strike with a nudge to the on side . Two overs to go.
full and straight, outside off stump, Ashraful drives but it makes contact with the bottom-half of the bat and it rolls over towards long off
on the legs, Rafique tries to lap it along, misses, and it runs off the pad
Another impressive stroke.  Full in length, outside off stump and he drove it inside-out, over extra cover. Orthodox and classy.
a low full-toss, bunted to long-on.
backs away to the legside, slams a length-delivery to sweeper cover. 7 legal deliveries left
almost holed out to long-off. Full-pitched on the off stump line and Ashraful drives uppishly, one bounce to the man at deep. He will face the first ball of the last over. Should be fun.

Would you believe it? There was no short fine leg, just a regulation deep fine leg. Ashraful shuffles across, paddles a low full-toss, connects sweetly and it flies straight to that man in the deep. Did Ashraful not see that the man was standing back or ...?  Five-for for Nel who has impressed today and sent out a notice to the selectors. But what a gem of a knock from Ashraful. Delightful and Yummy!
yorker-length, on the middle stump line, jabbed away to cover region
yorker on the leg side, Rafique backs away, places it to cover region for a single
slower one and he backed away and had a swing but doesn't connect. Just one delivery left.
charges down the track, swings at a length-delivery, misses and it bounces over the stumps.

inn2.comm: bowled on the pads, Smith plays a streaky inside out shot, the ball rolls to the off side
turned to the on side
full in length, on the middle and leg, turned to the on side
length-delivery, around the off stump line, dabbed to third man
rushes through the channel outside off, left alone. One slip and a short cover in place
lands outside off stump, full in length, swings away, left alone
slightly closer to the off stump line and moves away, again left alone
on the off stump line, defended down the track
length-delivery outside off stump, driven to point
lands on a length, on the off stump line, bent away, driven to mid-on
on the middle stump line, shovelled to midwicket
short in length, outside off stump, cut through cover point
sliding on to the leg and middle, flicked away past square-leg
full in length, on the middle and off stump line, driven back down the track
length-delivery on the middle stump line, punched through midwicket. That's his strong area.
short of length, outside off, Smith shapes to cut but mistimes it to cover point
full in length, on the middle and off stump line, Smith leans forward, opens the bat-face, guides to point
fullish, on the middle stump line, turned straight to short midwicket
on the leg and middle, glanced behind square-leg
full and outside off stump, run down to Rafique at wide third man
lands on a length, on the middle stump line, straightens a touch, driven back down the track. Rasel swoops to his left to make the stop.
pitched on the middle stump line, curved in slightly, punched towards mid-on and he will get a single.
full in length, on the off stump line, goes straight on, Smith guides to point. Pretty animated chat going on in the field.

full-pitched on the middle and leg, driven through midwicket. Mortaza rushes across from deep square-leg and cuts it off. They get only two. De Villiers had turned for the third but was sent back by Smith.
length-delivery on the off stump line, de Villiers leans forward, pushes it towards mid-off
length-delivery on the off and middle, punched down the track, Mortaza jumped up, to his right, to make the stop
fuller, around off stump, de Villiers respects the line and length and defends
slightly short in length, outside off stump, punched on the up, past point.
good length ball, straight on middle, worked away towards mid-on
driven wide of mid-on for a brace
accurate from Rasel again, he keeps it straight and waits for the batsmen to try something adventurous. Smith pushes it back to mid-on.
fielder at short extra cover does well to intercept Smith's crisp drive
pushed down to mid-off.

That's the mistake they were waiting for. Smith backs away from his stumps, Rasel keeps it straight on off. Smith realises he has gone too far outside off and tries to glide it to third man but misses and loses his off stump. Rasel is ecstatic. This is a big one for Bangladesh and do they know it
Slightly wide outside off and Kallis goes for the flash straight away, thickish edge flies to third man. That was streaky
accurate again, good length ball on off. de Villiers taps it to the off side. Bangladesh's fielders on the prowl now. There is a sting in their tail
Mashrafe continues to probe away. 133kph. Good length outside off. Kallis defends it to the off side solidly
nibbles at one outside off again, Kallis gets a thick edge and it flies past the wicketkeeper. First slip might have had a chance but Kallis living dangerously here.
straight and slightly full, turned away to the leg side
That was a jaffa. Pitched on off and moves away after pitching, even kicks up a bit and Kallis pokes tentatively. Beaten all ends up. Surpisingly still no slip. Bashar where art thou?
glides it to third man for a single, good probing line again
tipped towards short midwicket and scampers a quick single. There is a buzz around. Bangladesh sniff an opening
stand and deliver stuff. Straight ball from Rasel again, good length ball on middle and de Villiers goes for the pull wide of mid-on. Beats the field and races away
outside off and this time he defends it to the off side
Worked it to the leg side and complete a quick single. Javed Omar runs in and nails a direct hit but de Villiers just makes his ground
glided to third man for a single. Kallis knows how to play those
straight and accurate, blocked solidly down the ground
driven crisply but straight to the fielder at cover.
drifting down leg and Kallis moves across and gets a deflection off his pads for a couple to fine leg. Leg byes signalled.
fullish outside off, Kallis uses his typical poke to third man for another single. Kallis is the big wicket. The longer he stays the longer Bangladesh will fret.
back of a length outside off, moving back in well. de Villiers cramped for room, works it away to the leg side but no run
keeping it tight, straight and back of a length, de Villiers on the back foot and driving to mid-off
good variation of length, fuller this time. Most importantly, it's straight. No room for de Villiers to use and he pushes it to the off side firmly

not that short but de Villiers goes for the pull anyway. Can't get hold of it and the under-edge deflects off his pads. As long as it's straight, the batsmen will need to manufacture the strokes. Bangladesh working on that premise and waiting for the errors
too full, a bit too wide and Kallis goes boom. Leaning forward and driving through the covers for a crisp four. Width and he pounces
full and straight, much better. Driven down to mid-off. No room for him to free his arms
straight and effective. Full and just outside off, angling from over the wicket. Kallis tries a cute deflection to third man but misses. Opening the face but that was close to an edge.
straight again but Kallis manages to back-cut it to third man for a single. Good cat-and-mouse battle here.
slightly slower, on his pads, turned away straight to square leg
full and straight, de Villiers pushes forward, that was close to the pad. Had it struck the pad first, a huge appeal would have definitely gone up.
length-delivery on the off and middle, pushed out to cover

first he threatened to back away to leg, then he shuffled across and clipped a length-delivery on the hips, past square-leg. Ashraful gives the chase, dives in front, he dragged the rope behind. But they ran four
leans across, drives to cover
lands on a length, outside off, cuts back in, Kallis is cramped for room as he shapes to force it off the back foot, gets a outside edge to third man
full and outside off, de Villiers crashes it to cover but Omar pulls of a fine stop
fullish, on the middle and leg, slower one, pushed back to the bowler
full and around off stump, Kallis tries to spear it through the off side, edges it down to third man
length-delivery, on the leg and middle, worked past square-leg
Classy Kallis. Full-pitched, on the off stump line, driven inside-out through extra cover.
beaten. full in length, outside off stump, goes on with the angle, Kallis again tries to drive inside-out, misses
on the middle and leg, worked to square-leg
floated in, de Villiers tries to charge down, stops, dabs it short third man
short in length and pulled through midwicket
full in length, on the middle stump line, driven to cover
flatter on the off stump line, cut to point
full, straight, on the middle stump line, driven to cover
on a length, on the off stump line, Kallis tries to force it away, goes too hard with the delivery, to cover
full in length, on the off stump line, he tries to drive, gets a inside-edge to midwicket
Full and on the leg and middle, Kallis leans forward and picks it over wide midwicket.
on a length, around off and middle, tapped to backward point
fired in on the leg, fullish, Kallis tries to work it away, misses and it hits him on the boot
slips down the leg side
Dances down the track and plays it inside out over extra cover.
slightly short, outside off, cut to point
flatter, on the off stump line, keeps a tad low, Kallis brings his bat down, pushes it back
on the middle stump line, turned to the on side
short in length, slanting away from de Villiers who forces it to sweeper cover
lands on a length, on the middle stump line, defended away

Big wicket. Kallis falls. Lands on a length, goes with the angle, on the off and middle stump line, Kallis tries to heave it away, over the bowler, ends up dragging it towards mid-on. A dolly of a catch and Bangladeshi fielders erupt in joy. Rasel pumps his fist, Rahim runs towards him. The tigers are beginning to roar.
fullish, outside off stump, defended to cover.
slips down the leg side. Rahim moves across to gather. Remember, he is standing up to the stumps.
full-pitched ,outside off stump, Kemp tries to thrash it through off side, the bat-face shuts as he goes hard at it and the ball rolls back to the bowler.
lands on the off and middle, turns away, cut to point
floats in on the middle and leg, turns and de Villiers is squared-up a touch. Rahim likes that delivery. Says as much to the bowler

Razzak strikes with a lovely change of pace delivery. Slow through the air, lands on a length on the middle stump line and goes on straight with the arm. de Villiers is beaten by the lack of pace, then tries to cut it to thirdman and is beaten by the arm-ball. The middle stump is pegged back. Razzaq is ecstatic, Rahim ... well.... is over the moon. All the fielders converge. Bangladesh are on top here. England and West Indies will be extremely interested in this one.
lands outside off, turns in, deflected to midwicket
quickish arm-ball, on the off and middle, jabbed back to the bowler
leans forward, turns a full delivery to midwicket
on the off and middle, worked to cover
lands on the off and middle stump line, defended back down the track
on the middle and leg, goes on straight, dabbed to the on side
arm-ball and defended back down the track. The pressure is on.
fullish, outside off stump, driven to cover
turns in from outside off, dabbed back down the track
spins in from outside off stump, Prince leans forward, plays it back to the bowler
on the middle stump line, turned to midwicket
spins in from outside off, slightly short in length, punched towards mid-on for a quick single
full and on the off and middle, drives towards mid-off
leans forward to defend.
lands on the off and middle , turns towards off, pushed down the track
full and outside off, steered to point
slower through the air, on the middle stump line, driven to left of mid-on and they rush across for a quick single

Bangladesh tighten the screws further. They are climbing all over SA.  Slow through the air, outside off stump, Prince  tries to drive through the off side, is beaten in the flight, gets a inside-edge between mid-on and midwicket. Aftab swoops in from midwicket, throws the ball to Rafique who whips the bails off. Prince is short of the crease. They refer it upstairs. Out. Whatmore is delighted. He is seen clapping in the pavilion.
driven to mid-on
slipping on the leg side, turned past squareleg
floats in from outside off, leans forward and defended to the on side
slips down the leg wide, Kemp tries to tickle it fine, misses and Rahim also fails to gather.
slightly short in length, turns outside off, Boucher tries to cut, gets a under edge to the ground and Rahim makes the stop
fuller, yorker-length, jabbed back to the bowler.
lands on the off stump line, stops on Boucher who shaped to cut and ends up pushing to off side
fires in full and quick, driven back to the bowler.
arm-ball on the off stump line, nudged to point
comes in with the arm, on the middle and off, the bat comes a touch outside the line, gets a inside-edge to the leg side.
leans forward to defend
on the middle and leg, Boucher tries to sweep it hard, doesn't connect well
on the middle stump line, tapped down the track
outside off stump, full in length, it stops on Boucher who tries to drive, ends up turning it to midwicket. Just a single in the over.
That one kept low. Real low. Landed on a length outside off, Kemp shaped to cut but the ball shooted through and he is beaten.
slips down leg side
fuller, driven towards mid-off, Mashrafe moves across from extra cover, dives to make the stop. The body language of the fielders is something to watch. They sense something real special here.
driven to cover.
faster one, on the middle stump line, it turned sharply, dabbed to short third man.
leans forward to push at a arm-ball.
lands outside off, comes with the arm, pushed to cover
slightly short, keeps a touch low, Boucher shapes to cut but is beaten by the lack of bounce and pace, swats it to cover.
arm-ball that keeps low . Boucher brings his bat down in a hurry, jabs it away to point
comes down the track, Rafique drags back the length and Boucher adjust to defend
on the middle stump line, flicked to right of midwicket
comes down the track, drives to long on
floats in on the middle, driven through midwicket.
leans forward, drives through the on side

Smart  work from Rahim. Flighted delivery that landed on the off and middle and turned away. Kemp was beaten in the flight and then, by the turn. Rahim whips the bails off. They refer it to third ump. Kemp has dragged his foot back in time.
turning away from Kemp who runs it down to shor third man
on the middle stump line, driven to midwicket
on the off stump line, driven to long-off
drifts on to the leg side, tucked past square-leg
on the middle stump line, driven to long off
flighted delivery outside off stump, Boucher goes for a slog-sweep, edges it to the pad
came down the track, tried to whip it to on side, gets a edge to short third man
tossed up, defended back to the bowler
fired in on leg stump, turned to short fine leg
big shot! Boucher charges out to his crease, bowler fires it wide, he reaches across and goes through with his shot, and sends it miles into the stands over extra cover!

but not this time! Boucher goes! Again he shimmies down the track, again the bowler smartly fires it a little wider, he's not to the pitch of it but goes through with an attempted chip over the infield, gets under it, and ends up scooping it tamely down long-off's throat! Bangladesh on fire!

gone! Saqibul! Wow! Fires it in on middle and leg, the ball doesnt come onto the bat at all, Kemp loosely drives back down the track, leaden-footed, and Saqibul moves quickly to his right and pouches it, getting into a tangle with Prince, running for Gibbs,  at the other end, but he's got two in two! South Africa in dire straits! What a game, this cricket!
gently tossed up on middle and leg, worked to midwicket for one
lands on the middle and off, stops, Pollock drives, inside-edge on to the boot, bounds off the ground into Rahim's gloves.
slightly short in length, outside off, cut past point
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
slow through the air, o nthe off stump line, Gibbs is made to wait and he dabs it to off side.
faster this time - Rafique is mixing 'em up beautifully, nudged to the on side
floates in from outside off, Pollock tries to make room, no luck, dabs it to the off side
works this one towards mid-on for a single
from wide of the crease, on the middle stump line, Gibbs leans forward to defend
on the off stump line, pushed to cover
down the leg side, Gibbs tries to sweep, misses, goes off the pad
picks up a single with a deflection to behind square
short in length, on the off stump line, Gibbs tries to cut but is cramped for the room and punches it to cover point
comes in with the arm, driven to long on
on the off stump line, again he tries to back away. Again he is cramped. Ends up swatting it back to the bowler. That's a risky shot in these conditions.
on the middle stump line, driven down the track
full and on the legs, flicked past short fine leg fielder.
comes in with the arm, on the off and middle, driven to mid-off and they rush across for a quick single
lands outside off stump, spins with a bit of bounce, cut to right of the sweeper cover.
on the off and middle, goes on with the arm, pushed to the on side.
faster. short in length, outside off stump, Gibbs goes back, forces it to left of cover where Mortaza dives but can't stop. He is angry with himself.
on the middle and leg, turned to short fine-leg
slower through the air, on the off stump line, defended on the front foot
on the middle stump line, pushed to the on side
arm-ball that rushes on straight after landing just outside off stump, cut to deep point
short and on the middle, pulled away past square-leg
full, straight, on the middle and leg, turned to midwicket
slow in the air, drifts on the middle, goes on straight, Pollock waits, wrists it past square-leg
on the off stump line, punched back to the bowler
on the off stump line, patted to cover point for a quick single

up up and over long on. Gibbs waltzes down the track and lofts it over long on. Pollock is pretty happy with the stroke. The fielder was not on the ropes, was well inside and he couldn't back peddle in time. It just went over the ropes.
on the middle and leg, swept to short fine leg
another sweep. Another single.
tossed-up, outside off, driven to long-on.
lands on length, outside off stump, driven to left of cover.
length-delivery outside off, Gibbs eases forward, turns it to point
short in length, outside off, driven to mid-off
slower one, outside off, Gibbs waits, opens the bat-face, guides it to left of backward point

run out chance missed. Gibbs survives. Another slower one, Pollock cuts to left of Aftab Ahmed at point. Prince, the bye-runner for Gibbs, rushes across. Pollock retreats but Aftab fires a throw at the striker's end. Wrong end. misses and they run for the over throw
floated outside off, cut to right of sweeper cover where Omar rushes to his right, slides to make a neat stop
on the middle and leg, swept to long leg
on the middle stump line, Pollock leans forward, waits, places it to left of midwicket
slightly short on length, Gibbs backs away and cuts through the off side.
Now it's the turn of Pollock to cut.
drifts on to the leg and middle, Gibbs goes back, wrists it past square-leg for a single
length-delivery outside off, slashed away to third man
length ball, driven to sweeper cover for a single
slightly short and Gibbs is quick to rock back and pull it in front of square for another single. Crisply struck but straight to the sweeper on the leg side
full and wide, Pollock goes for the drive but can't get the timing right. Probably trying to hit too hard, trickles to short third man

Nailed 'em. Driven to mid-off and takes off for a single. And there he is ... Tamim Iqbal swoops down on the ball, picks up in one motion and lets rip a cracker of a direct hit. Pollock struggles to make his ground and is just short of his crease. It's referred upstairs and he's a goner. This appeared to be a promising partnership developing but one direct hit can change it all. Bangladesh, Bangladesh ... the chants go around the stadium
full and straight, swinging in. Gibbs presents the full face of the bat, gets on the front foot and drives crisply past the bowler. Beats mid-off but long-on mops up near the boundary line.
dropped short, spinning away wide. Gibbs cuts but can't get the timing right.
driven to long-on for a single. Asking rate upto 8.63 now. Gibbs will need to do it all now
drifting on the pads, strikes Nel on the leg and trickles to short fine
slightly back of a length and faster. Driven to long-off for a single
Cutely done that time. Outside off, slightly short, Gibbs turns the face of the bat at the last moment and nudges it down to third man for a couple. Well executed that
Sees the ball slightly short and backs away trying to cut, works it to the off side but it's straight to the cover fielder
Straight and quick, pushed back to the bowler
pitched on leg and spinning away, patted back

Classical left-arm spinner dismissal that. Flight and loop, unlike the quicker ones that preceeded it. Nel tries to push it back again but is beaten by the flight and only manages to tamely pop it back to the bowler. Rafique is waiting and plucks off a good low catch, throws the ball up in celebration and is mobbed by his team-mates. Rafique da, that old warhorse, knows a thing or two about this game, it seems
turned to short fine leg, no run
dart fired in quickly, Langeveldt gets his bat down just in time, back to the bowler
defended and gets a deflection from the pads
short in length, outside off, stops on the ball, swatted to the off side
arm-ball, on the off stump line, drives, gets a inside-edge to pad
lands on a length, goes on straight, defended on the front foot
outside off stump, short in length, cut past point
on the middle and off stump, Gibbs goes down on a bent knee, sweeps it to long leg
lands on a length, on the off stump, moves in, played to right of the bowler
slightly short in length, pulled pst midwicket
full and straigth, defended with a straight face of the bat
tossed-up, on the middle, driven to midwicket
lands short in length, on the off and middle, hurries off the turf, the bat comes down in time and he keeps it out.
on the middle stump line, turned to left of midwicket.
from wide of the crease, it lands on the off stump, keeps low, goes on straight, defended on the front foot
full and straight, pushed back to the bowler
on the off stump line, played quietly to cover.
fuller, driven to long off
Another sweep shot from Gibbs. He will get two. That brings Langeveldt on strike. Bangladesh won't complain.
Langeveldt gets off the strike with a drive to long-off
lands on the off and middle, turns away, pushed to cover
lands outside off, goes on straight, Gibbs is on the front foot, late-cuts it to short third man. The game is meandering.
o nthe middle stump line, driven through midwicket. Just one run screams you- know-who.
10overs. 1 wicket and 22 runs. That's Rafique's figures. Slightly short in length, outside off, cut to sweeper cover
on the middle and leg, flicked to deep midwicket
turns past Langeveldt who shapes to cut but misses
outside off, driven through cover
full and straight, driven back to the bowler
short in length, turned to square-leg
low full-toss, on the off and middle, driven to long on
slower one, off cutter, around off stump, dabbed to backward point
slightly short in length, on the middle and off stump line, pushed back to the bowler
on the middle and leg, flicked past square-leg
back of length, on the middle and leg, it keeps low, kept out by the batsman.
leans forward to defend a length-delivery.
on the middle and leg, worked to deep midwicket.
beaten. Flighted delivery, on the off stump line, lands on the rough, grips and turns away. Langeveldt is beaten trying to drive
this one is quicker and flatter. Thuds into the pad, loud shout for lbw but it was slipping down the leg side
lands on the middle and off, breaks away, Langeveldt leans forward and shoulders arms. Rahim doesn't think it was a genuine leave. ooh's and aah's from him.
full and straight, driven to long on
on the middle and leg, fullish, driven uppishly, to widish long on
overpitched outside off, driven to long off
full and outside off, slashed away to sweeper cover
slower one, on the middle and off, driven to long on
length-delivery on the off stump line, defended on the off side

And then they were one. Plumb. Landed on the middle stump line, went straight on, the bat came outside the line and the ball thudded into the back pad. In front of middle. Bangladesh inch closer to a famous win.
slips down the leg side, wide called.
lands on the off stump line, Ntini goes for an expansive drive, misses and the ball spits away
goes back, waits for the turn before pushing it to the off side
huge shout for a catch. Ntini pushes at a delivery which breaks away sharply and Rahim takes it and goes up in appeal. Not sure whether he got a nick there.
slightly short and cut past point
goes for a yorker, ends up as a low full-toss, driven to mid-off
Hello? FIrst four in quite some time. Overpitched outside offstump and Ntini drills it through extra cover
low full-toss, outside off stump, Ntini gets off the strike with a drive to long off
That's a monster hit. Low full-toss, on the middle and off stump line, swung over deep midwicket.
another full-toss, outside off stump, hit to sweeper cover
another low full-toss - quite a poor over this, driven to long off
on the middle and leg, defended on the front foot
on the off stump line, driven to cover
slips down the leg side, Rahim can't get across in time and it runs down to fine-leg boundary
on the off stump line, run down to backward point

Another famous win for Bangladesh. The players hug each other. This is definitely bigger than the win against India. SA were ranked no 1. No longer though. Now they slip to the second position. Tossed-up on the stumps, Ntini tries to flick it to the on side, gets a leading edge which balloons over cover. Mortaza runs back and takes it. The players mob each other. Stumps are grabbed as souvenirs. The show has just begun for Bangladesh. The celebrations will go long in the night in Dhaka and other parts of Bangladesh. They have a devoted contigent who live outside the country. This will be a special moment to all of them.  

This is Sriram Veera, signing off for Cricinfo. Good bye and good luck.
